concise_definition: n. 停电, 丧失意识, 短暂失忆; v. 使停电, 使失去意识

definitions.explanation_en: A complete loss of electrical power in a specific area, often due to equipment failure, overload, or natural disaster.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某一地区因设备故障、过载或自然灾害等原因导致的全面断电。
definitions.example_en: The storm caused a widespread blackout across the city.
definitions.example_cn: 这场风暴导致全市范围的大面积停电。

definitions.explanation_en: A temporary loss of consciousness or memory, often caused by alcohol, trauma, or medical conditions.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因酒精、外伤或医疗状况等原因导致的短暂意识丧失或记忆缺失。
definitions.example_en: He had a blackout after drinking too much at the party.
definitions.example_cn: 他在派对上喝得太多，出现了短暂失忆。

definitions.explanation_en: A deliberate suppression or censorship of information, especially in media or broadcasting, to prevent public access.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指为防止公众获取信息而有意对媒体或广播内容进行的压制或审查。
definitions.example_en: The government imposed a blackout on news of the protest to control public reaction.
definitions.example_cn: 政府对有关抗议的新闻实施了封锁，以控制公众反应。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause a loss of electrical power in an area.
definitions.example_en: The overloaded grid blacked out half the neighborhood.
definitions.example_cn: 过载的电网使半个街区停电了。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause someone to lose consciousness or memory temporarily.
definitions.explanation_cn: 使某人暂时失去意识或记忆。
definitions.example_en: The blow to his head blacked him out for several minutes.
definitions.example_cn: 头部的重击使他昏迷了数分钟。

comparison.analysis: “Power outage”（断电）是“blackout”的同义词，但更中性、更技术性，仅指电力中断，不包含意识丧失或信息审查的含义。而 “blackout” 语义更广，可指电力、意识或信息三方面的中断。
“Amnesia”（健忘症）是医学术语，指长期或病理性的记忆丧失，通常具有持续性或结构性原因。而 “blackout” 指的是短暂、突发的记忆缺失，常与酒精或创伤相关，是暂时性的。
“Censorship”（审查）泛指对信息、言论或出版物的压制，是广义的政治或社会行为。而 “blackout” 在此语境下特指媒体或广播的突然、强制性沉默，常带有临时性和突发性，更强调信息渠道的物理或技术性阻断。
